Îâ¥Ïä§Ï†úÎ™©: Bitcoin's Rivalry With Gold Plus Millennial Interest Gives It 'Considerable' Upside Potential: JPMorgan
Î≥∏Î¨∏: Bitcoin has proven itself to be a risk asset, not a safe haven, with ‚Äúconsiderable‚Äù potential upside, according to a Friday note from JPMorgan‚Äôs Global Quantitative and Derivatives Strategy team obtained by CoinDesk.      Writing to clients in ‚ÄúFlows & Liquidity,‚Äù one of JPMorgan's flagship publications, the authors said that characterizing bitcoin as a ‚Äúrisk‚Äù asset rather than a ‚Äúsafe‚Äù asset is ‚Äúmore appropriate‚Äù based on the leading cryptocurrency‚Äôs increased positive correlation with the Standard & Poor's 500 Index since March.      Bitcoin‚Äôs function as a risk asset is ‚Äúlikely more of a reflection of a need for an ‚Äòalternative‚Äô currency rather than a need for a ‚Äòsafe‚Äô asset or ‚Äòhedge‚Äô.‚Äù      ‚ÄúTo some extent, this is also true with gold,‚Äù the authors add, although the yellow metal‚Äôs volatility is notably lower than bitcoin‚Äôs.      How investors currently perceive bitcoin‚Äôs value implies that it could ‚Äúcompete more intensely‚Äù with gold as an "alternative" currency over the coming years, the analysts wrote. Bitcoin‚Äôs role as a gold competitor is amplified by millennial investors‚Äô interest in cryptocurrency, according to the note, and the inevitability of the younger investor demographic becoming ‚Äúover time a more important component‚Äù of the investor universe.      Read more: What Bitcoin Can Learn From Gold About Staying ‚ÄòClean‚Äô      Bitcoin‚Äôs market capitalization would have to increase by a factor of 10 before it could match the total private sector investment in gold, the author‚Äôs note, adding that ‚Äúeven a modest crowding out of gold as an alternative currency over the longer term would imply doubling or tripling of the bitcoin price from here.‚Äù      ‚ÄúIn other words, the potential long-term upside for bitcoin is considerable.‚Äù      Beyond millennial investor interest, the note highlights the significance of corporate and legacy investor interest giving credibility to bitcoin as an investment vehicle. Specifically, PayPal‚Äôs Wednesday announcement of support for bitcoin and alternative cryptocurrencies (altcoins) is ‚Äúanother big step toward corporate support for bitcoin,‚Äù according to the note.      The authors also identify ‚Äústrong growth‚Äù in institutional investor interest in bitcoin indicated by activity in CME futures and options markets. As of Thursday, for example, CME bitcoin futures markets quietly became the second-largest measured by open interest, overtaking BitMEX and Binance, two dominant crypto-only trading platforms.      Read more: Bitcoin‚Äôs Correlation With Gold Hits Record High      Utility as a store of value isn‚Äôt the only catalyst for potential upside, however. According to the authors, the price of bitcoin and altcoins could appreciate significantly if adopted as means of payment. "The more economic agents accept cryptocurrency as a means of payment in the future, the higher their utility and value,‚Äù the note says.      Ultimately, even though bitcoin ‚Äúlooks currently overbought for the near term,‚Äù the authors reiterate that the potential long-term upside for bitcoin is ‚Äúconsiderable.‚Äù
